Index: =================================================================== --- +++ @@ -0,0 +1,100 @@ + + + + + + + + Cheng-Syuan Wan + + +

Cheng-Syuan Wan

+ +
+
+
+ I am a PhD student in the Logic and Semantics Group at Tallinn University of Technology. +
+ My supervisors are Tarmo Uustalu and Niccolò Veltri. +
+
+
+

Contact

+ + + + + + + +
Email: cswan at cs ioc ee
Address: B424, Akadeemia tee 21b, 12618 Tallinn, Estonia
+
+
+
+

Research Interests

+ I am interested in structural proof theory and its connection with other disciplines. +
+ In particular, I am now working on +
    +
  • characterizing proof systems for variants of skew monoidal categories,
    • +
  • constructing categorical models for variants of multiplicative intuitionistic linear logics,
    • +
  • formalization of aforementioned proof systems in Agda.
    • +
+Keywords: Curry-Howard-Lambek correspondence, structural proof theory, intuitionistic logic, categorical logic, linear logic, skew monoidal category, Agda +
+
+
+

Publications

+
    +
  1. N. Veltri, C.-S. Wan. Semi-substructural logics with additives.
    + In T. Kutsia, D. Ventura, D. Monniaux, J. F. Morales, eds., Proc. of 18th Int. Wksh. on Logical and Semantic Frameworks with Applications, LSFA 2023 (Rome, July 2023) and 10th Wksh. of Horn Clauses for Verification and Synthesis, HCVS 2023 (Paris, Apr. 2023), v. 402 of Electron. Proc. in Theor. Comput. Sci., pp. 63-80. Open Publishing Assoc., 2024
    + Agda code pdf +
    2. +
  2. T. Uustalu, N. Veltri, C.-S. Wan. Proof theory of skew non-commutative MILL.
    + In A. Indrzejczak, M. Zawidzki, eds., Proc. of 10th Int. Conf. on Non-classical Logics: Theory and Applications, NCL 2022 (Lódź, March 2022), v. 358 of Electron. Proc. in Theor. Comput. Sci., pp. 118-135. Open Publishing Assoc., 2022.
    + Agda code pdf +
    3. +
+
+
+
+

Presentations

+
    +
  • Semi-Substructural Logics with Additives at +
      +
    • LSFA'23, Rome.
      • +
    +
  • Towards Skew Non-Commutative MILL with Additives at +
      +
    • LC'23, Milan.
      • +
    +
  • Skew multiplicative intuitionistic linear logic at +
      +
    • WLD'23, Tallinn.
      • +
    • PLEXUS Inaugural Conference, Lisbon.
      • +
    +
    • +
  • Proof theory of skew non-commutative MILL at +
      +
    • WLD'22, Tallinn.
      • +
    • NCL'22, Łódź.
      • +
    • LC'22, Reykjavík.
      • +
    +
    • +
+
+
+ Last update 26.04.2024 +
+

commits.name: Commit-0
commits.content:
Cheng-Syuan Wan

I am a PhD student in the Logic and Semantics Group at Tallinn University of Technology.
My supervisors are Tarmo Uustalu and Niccolò Veltri.

Contact

Email: cswan at cs ioc ee
Address: B424, Akadeemia tee 21b, 12618 Tallinn, Estonia

Research Interests

I am interested in structural proof theory and its connection with other disciplines.
In particular, I am now working on
  • characterizing proof systems for variants of skew monoidal categories,
  • constructing categorical models for variants of multiplicative intuitionistic linear logics,
  • formalization of aforementioned proof systems in Agda.
Keywords: Curry-Howard-Lambek correspondence, structural proof theory, intuitionistic logic, categorical logic, linear logic, skew monoidal category, Agda

Publication

  1. Tarmo Uustalu, Niccolò Veltri, Cheng-Syuan Wan. Proof theory of skew non-commutative MILL.
    In A. Indrzejczak, M. Zawidzki, eds., Proc. of 10th Int. Conf. on Non-classical Logics: Theory and Applications, NCL ‘22 (Lódz, March 2022), v. 358 of Electron. Proc. in Theor. Comput. Sci., pp. 118-135. Open Publishing Assoc., 2022. pdf

Presentations

  • Semi-Substructural Logics with Additives at
    • LSFA'23, Rome.
  • Towards Skew Non-Commutative MILL with Additives at
    • LC'23, Milan.
  • Skew multiplicative intuitionistic linear logic at
    • WLD'23, Tallinn.
    • PLEXUS Inaugural Conference, Lisbon.
  • Proof theory of skew non-commutative MILL at
    • WLD'22, Tallinn.
    • NCL'22, Łódź.
    • LC'22, Reykjavík.
Last update 12.07.2023
